intro: Goniophlebium albopunctatum, commonly known as the white-spotted flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Goniophlebium albopunctatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
